#summary How to install Trac On Debian/Ubuntu

= Introduction =

Here we  will show how to install [http://trac.edgewall.org/ Trac] with Apache2 (using mod_python), basic HTTP authentication, a SVN repository and Sqlite3 database on a Debian or Ubuntu system.

= Dependencies =

{{{
apt-get install subversion sqlite3 trac apache2 libapache2-mod-python
}}}

= Subversion =

First, we need to create the SVN repository somewhere:

{{{
svnadmin create svn-repo
}}}

= Apache configuration =

Create a site for trac that points to your project. On this example the user is arnau and the trac repository is located at /home/arnau/trac:

{{{
#/etc/apache2/sites-available/trac
<Location /trac>
    # ServerName trac.mycompany.com
    SetHandler mod_python
    PythonInterpreter main_interpreter
    PythonHandler trac.web.modpython_frontend
    PythonOption TracEnv /home/arnau/trac/myproject/
    PythonOption TracUriRoot /trac
    AuthType Basic
    AuthName "myproject"
    AuthUserFile /home/arnau/trac/.htpasswd
    Require valid-user
</Location>
}}}

And enable the site:

{{{
ln -s sites-available/trac sites-enabled/NNN-trac
}}}

You should also create the password file for basic HTTP authentication and add as many users as needed:

{{{
htpasswd -c .htpasswd arnau
}}}

= Configure Trac =

Create your project:

{{{
cd /home/arnau/trac
trac-admin myproject initenv
# select sqlite database
}}}

Give TRAC_ADMIN permission to the admin user:

{{{
trac-admin . permission add arnau TRAC_ADMIN
}}}

You will need to give _write_ rights to group _www-data_:

{{{
chown root.www-data /home/arnau/trac/db -R
chmod g+w /home/arnau/trac/db -R
}}}

= Ubuntu =

If you are using Ubuntu you may want to check this link:
